item.title: My calculator buttons not showing
item.dc:creator: @Server-Unknown.Net Server-Unknown.Net
item.description:
@Server-Unknown.Net wrote:

[table][tr][td]

[/td][td]Iâ€™m having a problem adding the buttons to my calculator, its looking weird :|, here is my code to my calculator:

[code]import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.FlowLayout;
import java.awt.GridLayout;
import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.JTextField;
import javax.swing.JPanel;

public class Interface {

public static JFrame frame = new JFrame();

public Interface(){
	JTextField	txtField = new JTextField(10);
	
	JPanel pnlNorth, pnlEast, pnlCenter;
	pnlNorth 	= new JPanel(new FlowLayout(FlowLayout.LEFT));
	pnlCenter 	= new JPanel(new GridLayout(4,3));
	pnlEast 	= new JPanel(new GridLayout(5,1,0,5));
	
	JButton btnAdd, btnMinus, btnDivide, btnMulti, btnEqual, btnBack, btnClear;
	btnAdd  	= new JButton("+");
	btnMinus 	= new JButton("-");
	btnDivide	= new JButton("/");
	btnMulti	= new JButton("*");
	btnEqual	= new JButton("=");
	btnBack		= new JButton("Backspace");
	btnClear	= new JButton("Clear");
	
	// Panels, this is the setup
	frame.add(pnlNorth, BorderLayout.NORTH);
	frame.add(pnlCenter, BorderLayout.CENTER);
	frame.add(pnlEast, BorderLayout.EAST);
	pnlNorth.add(txtField);
	pnlNorth.add(btnClear);
	pnlNorth.add(btnBack);
	pnlEast.add(btnAdd);
	pnlEast.add(btnMinus);
	pnlEast.add(btnDivide);
	pnlEast.add(btnMulti);
	pnlEast.add(btnEqual);
	
	// 
	frame.add(txtField);
	
	// JButtons numbers 1 - 9
	for(int i=0;i<10;i++){
		JButton btnNum = new JButton(""+i);
		pnlCenter.add(btnNum);
	}
}

public static void main(String[] args){
	Interface calculatorInterface = new Interface();
	
	frame.setTitle("S.U.N. Calculator");
	frame.setResizable(false);
	frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
	frame.pack();
	frame.setVisible(true);
}

}
[/code]
There is suppose to be numbers where the huge text field is, I thought the for loop would be a way to get them all there so I did just that and what I got is exactly what you see on the left.[/td][/tr][/table]
